description:
Pronto Dial allows you quickly dial, text, or email your most frequently used contacts. It is designed to mimic the look & feel of native WebOS apps to give a more seamless experience. Optimized for fast loadup, Pronto Dial is a great replacement for the Phone app on the Quick Launch bar.

Features: 
*Fast Loadup
*Supports multiple user customizable categories
*Reordering of categories & contacts
*One touch dialing/texting/email
*Drawers for accessing a contact's other phone numbers,
*Swiping to switch categories
*Selectable background colors for categories
*Copy/Move contacts between categories
*Customizable predefined messages
*Send your current location
*Customize a contact's name
*Group SMS/Email
*Backup to Google Docs or email w/ optional encryption
*Restore backups from Google Docs or from a file
*Mechanism to prevent accidental deletion
*Support for dialing with Voogle

Works with webOS 2.0, but custom labels on phone numbers and email addresses will only show up as 'OTHER'. This feature seems to be missing from the native Contacts app as well.

v1.6.6:
- Upgraded from Google Docs API to Google Drive API.
- Updated to support changes to Google authorization.

v1.6.5
- Minor internal changes
 
v1.6.4 
- Added support for Voogle 3.0
- Updated for the Pre3

v1.6.2 
- Fixed group send email for webOS 2.x devices. 

v1.6.1
- Fixed minor bug in verification of backup data during restore.
- Fixed bug where both an email and a phone number in the drawer will have a check mark when intially adding a contact. 

v1.6.0 
- App data backup to Google Docs or to Email with optional encryption.
- Restore backup data from Google Docs or from a file.
